intro: Alsophila australis, commonly known as the Australian tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and a crown of feathery fronds that can reach several meters in length. The plant belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests. Its rhizome system supports the growth of the trunk and produces new fronds, contributing to its slow but steady growth rate. Alsophila australis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
